member.name: T:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice
member.summary:
I/O Port device.
The I/O port device is a single device representing a single I/O port on one logical module on a sias instrument. In general the I/O Port device is sharing its logical module with other devices.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_IOPort
The interface includes - the port number configuration property - the port value property - some synchronize able port setting method .
%SIOPortDevice class diagram
\image html "SIOPortDevice.png"

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.GetErrorInfos
member.summary: This interface function returns the default error messages which can be generated by this device.

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.HandleModuleError(System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: This method handles the module errors of SIOPortDevice devices.
member.details: Possible Module types: - 0x003C (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_BC_READER") . Handled errors: - 0x10 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_RANGE_ERROR") at Error1 .
member.param: True to force the handler to handle the error

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary:
Single motor initialization method.
Mostly this initialization method is not called if the motor device is a sub device of another device e.g. an arm device or an Y/Z devices.
member.param: Initialization options (Init level (PreInit, Init, PostInit, UserInit) and Init Group 0..7)

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.PrepareSetPort(System.Int16)
member.summary: Change port to a new (16bit) value.
member.param: The new value of the port

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.PrepareSetPort(System.Byte)
member.summary: Change port to a new (byte) value.
member.param: The new value of the port

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.PrepareSetPort(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change port to a new (boolean) value.
member.param: The new value of the port

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.MessageReceivedEvent(System.Int32,Sias.CanDev.SCanMsg)
member.summary:
New message event.
This event handler is called each time a message is received. In case of using the port as auto port it recognizes an incoming port message and saves the port value. Together with the Request delay this can mostly avoid the need of polling.
member.remarks: Take care not to use too much auto ports and not try to debug this event, as the event will be called directly from the drivers background thread.

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.PrepareAutoPort(System.Int16)
member.summary: Change port to a new (16 bit) value and set the port to auto port mode. If the port is used as input, the port output value should be the value needed to configure the port as input.
member.param: The new value of the port

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.PreparePulsePort(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary:
Prepare a port pulse.
The port changes its value to the given new value, but after the given time it changes back to the origin value without the need of an additional software command.
member.remarks: This functionality needs to be supported by the firmware. Not all Ports are supporting this feature!
member.param: The new value of the port

member.name: M:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.PrepareBlinkPort(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary:
Prepare a "blinking" port.
The port value changes automatically after each \a period defined by the given time between the actual port value and the given value. It is recommended to use a standard set port before using this to be sure the port is actually at the expected value.
member.remarks: This functionality needs to be supported by the firmware. Not all Ports are supporting this feature!
member.param: The new value of the port

member.name: P:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.PortNumber
member.summary: Port number property

member.name: P:Sias.IOPort.SIOPortDevice.InitValue
member.summary: Initial value property.
member.remarks: This value is not set automatically, but it can be used by the application to init the port and to activate the auto port feature.

member.summary: Port value property.
member.remarks: Reading or writing this property communicates with the physical device, so this can result in a communication error.
